definition: The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.

definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The Qiao Fu is tough is one impossible mission, the nobody comes us to have what recruit son.

definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: before the troops move, fodder and provisions go first (idiom); logistics comes before military maneuvers/an army marches on its stomach

definition: a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents

definition: Easy to raise an army of one thousand, but hard to find a good general. (idiom)
pinyin: qian1 jun1 yi4 de2 , yi1 jiang4 nan2 qiu2

definition: to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
ample scope for abilities/favorable position for the use of one's skills (idiom)
